text: Hi Ruairidh! I'd like to ask you what you're doing currently and the different career directions you took?

ooo thats a deep question, at the moment im a modeller at Framestore london working on Wonder Woman 2 , jsut finished on Alita battle angel ( a list of films i have been on <https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9526240/> ) . I have always wanted to be a modeller so its been an easy path for me to follow, but while learning the software and skills i have worked in bars, restaurants, call centres and clothes shops. Needed to pay the bills while i was learning as i didnt go through a university route i did self teaching. There was one point i though i would be a famous biker but that was just the madness of ebing a teenager

attachments.title: Ruairidh MacNeill
attachments.text: Ruairidh MacNeill, Visual Effects: Avengers: Infinity War

text: Oh, famous biker did not see that coming.
Was that at a young age, knowing you wanted to be a modeller?

from about 8 i knew i wanted to do 3d was probably from around 12/13 modelling started to over take everything else. had to learn texturing as part of it but modelling was the bit that really took my fancy
Wow, that's amazing! :slightly_smiling_face: I beginning to love 3d and want to learn everything about it. I guess for me is to experiment with my career, as I'm not sure what I want to do exactly?
I guess for me, knowing a modeller's lifestyle may help me decide (if I can picture that as my career).
My question is what's a day-to-day modeller's lifestyle?

day to day isnt really how we work, I normally get given an asset that has some concept art and some kind of scale reference normally a basic human. i then go through block out ( really rough basic shapes to get the form ) i will then work it up in levels so a first pass for main details, a second for details and a 3rd for extra high level detailing / scale setting objects. after that i will UV the object, run some checks to make sure it all works and hand it to the next department. this can take between 1 day to 9 months depending on what the asset is. I have a meeting at 10.30 am everyday in out mini cinema to have my work reviewed and will add in any updates or details based on that. Otherwise ite pretty much a free for all artistic creation as long as i stay close to concept . That pattern is pretty much the same for all departments
Have you or know anyone that's dabbled into entrepreneurship?
